{{about|a song called "Aneurysm"|the medical condition|Aneurysm}} {{Infobox single | Name = Aneurysm | Cover = nirvana_aneurysm.png | Artist = [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]] | Album = [[From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah]] | Released = October 8, 1996 | Format = [[Promotional recording|Promo CD single]] | Recorded = December 28, 1991 in [[Del Mar, California|Del Mar]], [[California|CA]] | Genre = [[Grunge]] | Length = 4:35 | Label = [[Geffen Records|DGC]] | Writer = {{flatlist| * [[Kurt Cobain]] * [[Dave Grohl]] * [[Krist Novoselic]] }} | Producer = {{flatlist| * [[Westwood One (1976–2011)|Westwood One]] * [[Andy Wallace (producer)|Andy Wallace]] }} | Last single = "[[About a Girl (Nirvana song)|About a Girl"]]
(1994) | This single = "'''Aneurysm'''"
(1996) | Next single = "[[You Know You're Right]]"
(2002) }} "'''Aneurysm'''" is a song by the [[United States|American]] [[grunge]] band [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]. Two studio versions have been released,St Thomas, Kurt and Smith, Troy. pp. 252–253. and a live version from the album ''[[From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah]]'' was released as a [[Promotional recording#Promo single|promotional single]] in 1996.St Thomas, Kurt and Smith, Troy. pp. 242 and 252–253. ==Song meaning== According to the 2001 [[Kurt Cobain]] biography ''[[Heavier Than Heaven]]'' by [[Charles R. Cross]], Cobain wrote the lyrics to "Aneurysm" about his ex-girlfriend, musician [[Tobi Vail]].Cross, Charles R. (2012) [1st ed. 2001]. Heavier Than Heaven. A Biography of Kurt Cobain. New York: Hachette. ISBN 1-444-71712-X. ISBN 978-1-44471712-9. Cobain's lyrics for the song make fun of pop conventions and drug-use rituals ("shoot the shit"), ("beat me out of me").Crisafulli. pp. 77. Cobain's lyrics for the song allude to the first time he spent time with Tobi, when he got so nervous he had to throw up: "Love you so much, makes me sick!" He also wrote it as a dark love song to try to get her back and to describe how the break-up devastated him: "Come on over...do the twist, Overdo it...and have a fit!"Cross, Charles. R. ''Heavier Than Heaven. A Biography of Kurt Cobain''. p. 169 ==Recording and release history== The first studio version of "Aneurysm" was recorded on January 1, 1991 by producer Craig Montgomery and appeared as a B-side to Nirvana's 1991 single "[[Smells Like Teen Spirit]]".St Thomas, Kurt and Smith, Troy. pp. 79. This version has been released on several subsequent Nirvana releases. The second studio version of "Aneurysm" was recorded at [[Maida Vale Studios]] on November 9, 1991 for [[Mark Goodier]]'s [[BBC]] session,Crisafulli. pp. 77. and was first aired on November 18, 1991.St Thomas, Kurt and Smith, Troy. pp. 118. This version was released on the ''[[Incesticide]]'' compilation album in December 1992. In a review for [[AllMusic]], music critic [[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]] said of the song "Aneurysm" on ''Incesticide'', that it was "perhaps the greatest single song the group ever recorded".[http://www.allmusic.com/album/incesticide-mw0000092480 Nirvana - Incesticide - AllMusic review by Stephen Thomas Erlewine] allmusic.com. Retrieved May 20, 2016. A live performance of "Aneurysm" by Nirvana at [[Del Mar Fairgrounds]], California, in 1991 was later released on the live album ''[[From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah]]'' in 1996, from which it was a [[Promotional recording#Promo single|promotional single]]. The single reached number 11 on the [[Mainstream Rock (chart)|Mainstream Rock Tracks]] chart and number 13 on the [[Alternative Songs|Modern Rock Tracks]] chart.[http://www.allmusic.com/artist/nirvana-mn0000357406/awards Nirvana - All Music Guide - Awards] allmusic.com. Retrieved December 21, 2013. ===Studio versions=== {| class="wikitable" !Date recorded !Studio !Producer/recorder !Releases !Personnel |- |January 1, 1991 |Studio A, The Music Source, Seattle, WA, US |Craig Montgomery |''[[Smells Like Teen Spirit]]'' (1991)

January 23, 1993
(in two parts) |[[Paradiso (Amsterdam)]]/

(1994 [[VHS]] / 2006 [[DVD]]) | *Kurt Cobain (vocals, guitar) *Dave Grohl (drums) *Krist Novoselic (bass) |- |December 28, 1991 |[[Del Mar Fairgrounds]], [[California]] |''[[From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah]]'' (1996) | *Kurt Cobain (vocals, guitar) *Dave Grohl (drums) *Krist Novoselic (bass) |- |August 30, 1992 |[[Reading and Leeds Festivals|Reading Festival, England]] |''[[Live at Reading]]'' (2009) | *Kurt Cobain (vocals, guitar) *Dave Grohl (drums) *Krist Novoselic (bass) |} ==Music video== The footage from the ''Live! Tonight! Sold Out!!'' video was used as a promotional video on [[MTV]] for the ''From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah'' album in 1996.[http://www.americanradiohistory.com/hd2/IDX-Business/Music/Archive-Billboard-IDX/IDX/90s/1996/BB-1996-10-12-OCR-Page-0096.pdf#search=%22nirvana%20aneurysm%22 Billboard magazine - September 29, 1996 - p. 104 - "Video Monitor" section] americanradiohistory.com. ISBN 951-1-21053-X. | align=center|40 |- | Poland ([[Lista Przebojów Programu Trzeciego|LP3]]){{cite web|url=http://lp3.polskieradio.pl/utwor/artykul5808,381_aneurysm.aspx|title=ANEURYSM|publisher=[[Polskie Radio]]|accessdate=November 14, 2016}} | style="text-align:center;"|17 |- {{singlechart|Billboardradiosongs|63|artist=Nirvana}} |- {{singlechart|Billboardmainstreamrock|11|artist=Nirvana}} |- {{singlechart|Billboardalternativesongs|13|artist=Nirvana}} |} {{s-start}} {{succession box | before = "[[Muzzle (song)|Muzzle]]" by [[The Smashing Pumpkins]] | title = Canadian [[RPM (magazine)|''RPM'']] [[Canadian rock/alternative chart|Alternative 30 number-one single]] | years = November 4–18, 1996 | after = "[[Stinkfist]]" by [[Tool (band)|Tool]] }} {{s-end}} ==Covers== Nashville songwriter/producer, [[Shane Tutmarc]] released an all electronic version of the song as a single, and music video, in 2013.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WIPFBDN0lNg ==References== *Azerrad, Michael. ''Come as You Are: The Story of Nirvana'', Doubleday, New York: 1993, ISBN 0-86369-746-1 ==Notes== ==Bibliography== *Crisafulli, Chuck. Nirvana: The Stories Behind the Songs. Omnibus Press.(1996). ISBN 0-7119-5809-2. *St Thomas, Kurt and Smith, Troy. Nirvana: The Chosen Rejects. St Martin's Griffin (2004). ISBN 0-312-20663-1. ==External links== {{external media | align = right | video1 = {{YouTube|PvwqSMRtoSI|Nirvana - Aneurysm (Live at Reading 1992)}}, Nirvana[[Vevo|VEVO]] }} *[http://www.livenirvana.com/digitalnirvana/discography/nirvana/aneurysm_promo_vhs.html http://www.livenirvana.com/digitalnirvana/discography/nirvana/aneurysm_promo_vhs.html] *[http://www.livenirvana.com/digitalnirvana/discography/nirvana/pro-cd-1033_usa.html http://www.livenirvana.com/digitalnirvana/discography/nirvana/pro-cd-1033_usa.html] {{Nirvana (band)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aneurysm (Song)}} [[Category:1991 songs]] [[Category:1996 singles]] [[Category:Nirvana (band) songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Kurt Cobain]] [[Category:Songs written by Dave Grohl]] [[Category:Live singles]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Butch Vig]] [[Category:Songs written by Krist Novoselic]]
